Buttons.Button: The Layout Parameters button () opens the . It allows to define parameters for the selected layout template.
The Show/Edit button () permits to see and to edit the selected layout template.
The Edit button () opens the Edit Activation Expression Dialog that permits writing the condition script.
The Move to File button () moves the code into a file.

The Conditional Visibility button () opens the Conditional Visibility Dialog. It allows to define specific rules that permit to assign a visibility/disable condition to multiple elements at the same time.

The Negated button () allows to quickly use the negated version of the selected expression without the need of declaring a very similar expression which differs from the selected one just for a not clause.
The Conditional Layouts button () opens the . It allows to define more specific rule for the selected Attribute Layout.
The Conditional Layouts button () opens the . It allows to define more specific rule for the selected Field Layout.
The Conditional Layouts button () opens the . It allows to define more specific rule for the selected Event Layout.

The Configure button () opens the Component Layout Configuration Dialog. It permits to associate a Component Layout to each type of component choosing it among the available component layouts. If you do not select a component layout at the level, the component layout is inherited.
The Browse button () permits to select a script file from the workspace.
The Edit button () opens the script editor on the selected workspace file.
The Open Binding Parameters button () opens the Parameters Binding Dialog for defining the parameter binding of the flow.
